alert.note: Alert for Stanly (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 12:17PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Stanly County through 1245 PM EDT... At 1217 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Midland, or 13 miles southeast of Downtown Concord, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Locust, Stanfield and Finger. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
